message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a meta-learning framework for one-shot imitation learning, which involves training a neural net to generalize to new situations of a given task from very few demonstrations. This involves a large set of tasks with many instantiations, and the use of soft attention to allow the model to generalize to unseen conditions and tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.RO (Robotics), which are all related to the core concepts of the paper. Additionally, cs.CV (Computer Vision) is also likely, as the paper mentions the use of visual inputs (e.g. blocks on a table) for the tasks. Finally, cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also a possible sub-category, as the paper deals with the problem of learning robust policies for a variety of tasks.
